text: Alghero (Italian pronunciation: [alˈɡɛro]; , IPA: [ɫəɫˈɣe], locally: [lalˈɣe]; ; ), is a city of about 44,000 citizens in Italy. It lies in the province of Sassari in northwestern Sardinia, next to the sea. In the 1930s, the Swedish writer Amelie Posse Brazdova wrote a book entitled Sardinia Side Show, where she told the complete story of 2 years she spent "interned" in Alghero old town during World War I. ==References== ==Other websites== *City of Alghero Official website *Official Alghero tourism web site *Alghero Tourist Informations and Webcam Live *Alghero Tourism and Town Information *Alghero Tourism and Hotels Informations Category:Communes of the Province of Sassari
